main event: A spherical object, first appearing as a small oval mass of light, approached an observer at over 1,000 mph in Lathrop Wells, Nevada.
interesting points: The object halted momentarily, appeared to make a 22-25 degree turn, then began a sudden climb with acceleration before extinguishing and distancing itself gradually.
The object exhibited no noise at any time.

Another sighting reported an unidentified flying object approximately 25-30 feet in diameter, with a changing brightness and color from amber to green, maneuvering in a zig-zag fashion and accelerating to over 1,000 mph.
A third sighting described an elongated, lighted object making a buzzing sound as it moved swiftly across the sky.
The reports include hand-drawn maps or sketches of the geographic locations of the sightings.
sighted object: spherical, circular or disc-shaped objects with various luminous and maneuvering characteristics
witnesses: USAF (Rated Observer), Shift Leader and Airman at Lathrop Wells Air Force Base
photographs: no photographs included in the reports
